page.title: 20NEWLAND WITH REDBROOK
page.content: In this parish the population of{ {Redbrook}increased with the develop- ment of the tin-plate works, the brew- ery and the boats on the river. As a result of this the{Church of St. {Saviour}and{Redbrook C. of E. School were built and opened in 1874. The school then admitted Newland and Red- brook children. The church and school have always worked closely together and it is hoped that this will continue. The Church at Redbrook has also been restored over the last few years. It is now used for all sorts of events: fetes, bazaars, school events and concerts. Above all the church is for local people to use: to sit and be quiet, to pray, to join in some event, to meet people, to give thanks, to re- member, to sing and to worship. In a way it is the soul of the village.
